title: Overview
text:
Welcome to the International Masterclass on “Digital Technologies in the African city”!
This event is co-organised by the Department of Geography from the Ecole normale supérieure, the African Centre for Cities at the University of Cape Town, and the IFRA-Nigeria, with the financial support of the Translitterae program.
The masterclass will gather 20 graduate students from Nigeria, France and South Africa for 8 days of conferences, workshops and fieldwork that will explore and question how digital technologies, from data centres to smartphone apps, reshape urban economies and daily livelihoods, within and beyond Cape Town.
The masterclass will take place on the UCT campus from April 3rd to April 12th 2023.

title: Preliminary schedule
text:
This program is preliminary and will be finalized ahead of the masterclass to take into account the availability of guest speakers.




Morning
Afternoon




Sunday 2nd

Participants from France and Nigeria arrive at the Lenox Guest House.


Monday 3rd
8:30-9:00 Welcome 9:30-10:45 Introduction  11:00-12:00 Guest speaker: Edgar Pieterse (ACC)
1:00-2:00 Guest Speaker: Kelle Howson (Oxford-Fairwork)  2:00-4:00 Guest speaker TBC  5:00-6:00 Debrief & Discussion*


Tuesday 4th
8:00-10:30 Guest speaker Ian Thompson, founder of Toomuchwifi. Venue: Jordan’s in Langa.  11:00-12:00 Guest speaker: Nancy Odendaal (UCT)
2:00-4:00 Guest speaker from Teraco. Site visit of CT2 data centre.  5:00-6:00 Debrief & Discussion


Wednesday 5th
11:00-12:00 Guest speaker: Alicia Fortuin (ACC)
2:00-4:00: Site visit at La French Tech.  5:00-6:00 Debrief


Thursday 6th
9:00-12:00 Designing group projects
1:00 Group projects  5:30-6:30 Debrief


Friday 7th
Group projects
Group projects  5:00-6:00 Debrief


Saturday 8th
Group projects
Group projects  5:00-6:00 Debrief


Sunday 9th
Day off



Monday 10th

Tuesday 11th
Consolidation.  Venue: UCT campus
Consolidation


Wednesday 12th
Consolidation
2:00-4:30 Project presentations.  5:00-6:00 Concluding remarks.  6:30 Closing braai at the Lenox.


Thursday 13th
Participants depart




*(1) Unless specified, all guest lectures will take place on the UCT campus.
*(2) Unless specified, all debriefs will take place at the Lenox Guest House. Provisions have been taken to allow for UCT students to enter the premises upon presentation of their student cards.

title: People
text:
Participants







At the University of Cologne in Germany, June Gbadamosi is a Coimbra Group Fellow. She is a research fellow with IFRA and a PhD candidate at the University of Ibadan. Her research interests lie at the intersection of digital cultural identities, media, and African Studies. Her current research focuses on Nigeria and examines how digital indentures are changing cultural and digital environments.

::::
To be announced soon.

This masterclass was designed with the help and guidance of Liza Cirolia, Laura Nkula-Wenz, Andrea Pollio & Anna Selmeczi.

Julien Migozzi is an Urban Studies Foundation Postdoctoral Research Fellow at the University of Oxford. An urban and economic geographer, his research interests lie at the intersection of financial geography, urban studies and economic sociology. Julien’s current project examines how digital technologies reshape real estate markets, focusing on South Africa.

title: Materials
text:
To see and listen

Miller, J. Unequal Scenes: South Africa

title: Materials
text:
Anwar, M. A., & Graham, M. (2022). The Digital Continent: Placing Africa in Planetary Networks of Work. Oxford University Press. [Only prologue and Chapter 2]
Bronsvoort, I., & Uitermark, J. L. (2022). “Seeing the street through Instagram. Digital platforms and the amplification of gentrification”. Urban Studies, 59(14), 2857–2874.
Guermond, V. (2022) “Whose money? Digital remittances, mobile money and fintech in Ghana, Journal of Cultural Economy, 15:4, 436-451.
Pollio A. & Cirolia, L. (2022) “Fintech urbanism in the startup capital of Africa”, Journal of Cultural Economy, 15:4, 508-523.
Pollio, A. (2020). Making the silicon cape of Africa: Tales, theories and the narration of startup urbanism, Urban Studies, 57(13), 2715–2732.
Rosen, J. & Alvarez León, LF. (2022) The Digital Growth Machine: Urban Change and the Ideology of Technology, Annals of the American Association of Geographers, 112:8, 2248-2265.
